description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Original DAO.

hook.text: In 2016, 'The DAO' raised $150 million in Ethereum. It was the largest crowdfund in history â€” and it lasted 3 months.

buildup.text: The DAO was a venture fund controlled by token holders. Anyone could propose projects and vote on funding.

discovery.text: A hacker found a bug in The DAO's smart contract and drained $60 million in Ether.

twist.text: To recover the funds, Ethereum did a controversial hard fork â€” rewriting history. This split the community forever.

climax.text: The fork created Ethereum and Ethereum Classic. The first DAO's failure shaped the entire blockchain industry.

punchline.text: The first DAO failed so spectacularly it split an entire blockchain in two.
